section.name: s1
section.heading: Interpretation
section.leadIn: In this Regulation, unless the context otherwise requires—

def.name: ArmouredCombatVehicle
def.leadIn: armoured combat vehicle (裝甲戰鬥車) means any tracked, semi-tracked or wheeled self-propelled vehicle, with armoured protection and cross-country capability, either—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: designed and equipped to transport a squad of 4 or more infantry personnel; or (L.N. 5 of 2010)

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: armed with an integral or organic weapon of at least 12.5 mm calibre or a missile launcher;

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: means any rotary-wing aircraft designed, equipped or modified to engage targets by employing guided or unguided anti-armour, air-to-surface, air-to-subsurface, or air-to-air weapons and equipped with an integrated fire control and aiming system for those weapons; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: includes any version of an aircraft described in paragraph (a) that performs specialized reconnaissance or electronic warfare missions;

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: a police officer;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: a member of the Customs and Excise Service holding an office specified in Schedule 1 to the Customs and Excise Service Ordinance (Cap. 342); or

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: a public officer employed in the Customs and Excise Department in the Trade Controls Officer Grade;

section.def: aviation fuel (航空燃料) means fuel used or intended for use in aircraft, including aviation gasoline, naphtha-type jet fuel, kerosene-type jet fuel and kerosene-type rocket fuel; (L.N. 122 of 2018)

battle tank (作戰坦克) means any tracked or wheeled self-propelled armoured fighting vehicle with high cross-country mobility and a high-level of self-protection, weighing at least 16.5 metric tons unladen weight, with a high muzzle velocity direct fire main gun of at least 75 mm calibre;
cargo (貨物) includes personal baggage and checked baggage; (L.N. 122 of 2018)

Classification List (分類表) means the Hong Kong Imports and Exports Classification List (Harmonized System) 2017 Edition issued by the Commissioner of Customs and Excise by G.N. (S.) 61 of 2016 published in the Gazette on 11 November 2016; (L.N. 122 of 2018)

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: means any fixed-wing or variable-geometry wing aircraft, or any primary trainer aircraft, designed, equipped or modified to engage targets by employing guided missiles, unguided rockets, bombs, guns, cannons or other weapons of destruction; and

paragraph.name: b

section.def: Commissioner (關長) means the Commissioner of Customs and Excise, any Deputy Commissioner of Customs and Excise or any Assistant Commissioner of Customs and Excise; (L.N. 5 of 2010)
Committee (委員會) means the Committee of the Security Council established under paragraph 12 of Resolution 1718; (L.N. 5 of 2010)
DPRK (朝鮮) means the Democratic People’s Republic of Korea;

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: means a body corporate—

subparagraph.name: A
subparagraph.content: is authorized or recognized as a bank in the place where it is incorporated; or

subparagraph.name: B
subparagraph.content: may, whether or not in or outside the place where it is incorporated, lawfully take deposits from the general public, whether or not on current account; and
that is, or is owned or controlled by, a person connected with the DPRK; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: includes a branch, subsidiary or representative office of such a body corporate; (L.N. 122 of 2018)

section.def: economic resources (經濟資源) means assets of every kind, whether tangible or intangible, movable or immovable, which are not funds but can be used to obtain funds, goods or services; (L.N. 5 of 2010)
financial institution (金融機構) means a bank or any other person performing financial services commensurate with those provided by banks; (L.N. 122 of 2018)

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: gold coin, gold bullion, cash, cheques, claims on money, drafts, money orders and other payment instruments;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: deposits with financial institutions or other entities, balances on accounts, debts and debt obligations;

paragraph.name: c
d
paragraph.content: interest, dividends or other income on or value accruing from or generated by property;

paragraph.name: e
paragraph.content: credit, rights of set-off, guarantees, performance bonds or other financial commitments;

paragraph.name: f
paragraph.content: letters of credit, bills of lading and bills of sale; and

paragraph.name: g
paragraph.content: documents evidencing an interest in funds or financial resources, and any other instrument of export financing;

section.def: large-calibre artillery system (大口徑火炮) means any gun, howitzer, artillery piece combining the characteristics of a gun or howitzer, mortar or multiple-launch rocket system, capable of engaging surface targets by delivering primarily indirect fire, with a calibre of 75 mm and above;
licence (特許) means a licence granted under section 10I(1), 10J(1) or (6), 10K(1), 10L(1), 10M(1), 10N(1), 10O(1), 11(1), 11A(1), (3) or (5) or 11B(1); (L.N. 122 of 2018)
luxury goods (奢侈品) means any item specified in Schedule 1; (L.N. 115 of 2014)

def.name: MissileAndMissileLauncher
def.leadIn: missile and missile launcher (導彈及導彈發射器) means—

paragraph.name: a
b
paragraph.content: any means, other than any armoured combat vehicle, attack helicopter, battle tank, combat aircraft, large-calibre artillery system or warship, designed or modified specifically for launching any rocket or missile described in paragraph (a); or

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: any Man-portable Air-Defence Systems (MANPADS),

def.continued: but does not include any ground-to-air missile;

def.name: PersonConnectedWithTheDPRK
def.leadIn: person connected with the DPRK (有關連人士) means—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the Government of the DPRK;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: any person in, or resident in, the DPRK;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: any body incorporated or constituted under the law of the DPRK;

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.leadIn: any body, wherever incorporated or constituted, which is controlled by—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: the Government mentioned in paragraph (a);

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: a person mentioned in paragraph (b); or

subparagraph.name: iii
subparagraph.content: a body mentioned in paragraph (c); or (L.N. 5 of 2010)

paragraph.name: e
paragraph.leadIn: any person acting on behalf of—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: the Government mentioned in paragraph (a);

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: a person mentioned in paragraph (b); or

subparagraph.name: iii

section.def: pilot in command (機長), in relation to an aircraft, means the pilot designated by the operator or the owner, as appropriate, as being in charge of the aircraft (without being under the direction of any other pilot in the aircraft) and charged with the safe conduct of a flight; (L.N. 5 of 2010; L.N. 122 of 2018)
procurement-sanctioned item (獲取受制裁項目) means an item specified in Schedule 4; (L.N. 122 of 2018)

paragraph.name: a
b
paragraph.content: any luxury goods; or (L.N. 122 of 2018)

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: any procurement-sanctioned item; (L.N. 122 of 2018)

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: an entity named in the list published under section 31(1);

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: an entity—

subparagraph.content: acting on behalf of;
acting at the direction of; or
owned or controlled by,

paragraph.continued: an individual or entity named in that list; or

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.leadIn: an entity owned or controlled by an individual or entity—

subparagraph.content: acting on behalf of; or
acting at the direction of,

paragraph.continued: an individual or entity named in that list; (L.N. 122 of 2018)

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: an individual named in the list published under section 31(1); or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: an individual—

subparagraph.content: acting on behalf of; or
acting at the direction of,

paragraph.continued: an individual or entity named in that list; (L.N. 122 of 2018)

section.def: Resolution 1718 (《第1718號決議》) means Resolution 1718 (2006) adopted by the Security Council on 14 October 2006;
Resolution 1874 (《第1874號決議》) means Resolution 1874 (2009) adopted by the Security Council on 12 June 2009; (L.N. 122 of 2018)
Resolution 2087 (《第2087號決議》) means Resolution 2087 (2013) adopted by the Security Council on 22 January 2013; (L.N. 122 of 2018)
Resolution 2094 (《第2094號決議》) means Resolution 2094 (2013) adopted by the Security Council on 7 March 2013; (L.N. 115 of 2014)
Resolution 2270 (《第2270號決議》) means Resolution 2270 (2016) adopted by the Security Council on 2 March 2016; (L.N. 122 of 2018)
Resolution 2321 (《第2321號決議》) means Resolution 2321 (2016) adopted by the Security Council on 30 November 2016; (L.N. 122 of 2018)
Resolution 2356 (《第2356號決議》) means Resolution 2356 (2017) adopted by the Security Council on 2 June 2017; (L.N. 122 of 2018)

Resolution 2397 (《第2397號決議》) means Resolution 2397 (2017) adopted by the Security Council on 22 December 2017; (L.N. 122 of 2018)
Secretary (局長) means the Secretary for Commerce and Economic Development; (L.N. 122 of 2018)
Security Council (安全理事會) means the Security Council of the United Nations;

Security Council Resolutions (《安理會相關決議》) means Resolution 1718, Resolution 1874, Resolution 2087, Resolution 2094, Resolution 2270, Resolution 2321, Resolution 2356, Resolution 2371, Resolution 2375 and Resolution 2397; (L.N. 122 of 2018)
specified arms (指明軍火) means any arms referred to in item 1 of Schedule 2; (L.N. 5 of 2010; L.N. 115 of 2014)
supply-sanctioned item (供應受制裁項目) means an item specified in Schedule 3; (L.N. 122 of 2018)
vehicle (車輛) includes a train; (L.N. 122 of 2018)

warship (軍艦) means any vessel or submarine armed and equipped for military use with a standard displacement of 500 metric tons or above, or any vessel or submarine with a standard displacement of less than 500 metric tons, equipped for launching missiles with a range of at least 25 km or torpedoes with similar range.

section.name: s1A
section.heading: Prohibitions subject to general licence
section.content: A person may do any act that is otherwise prohibited by any provision of this Part if the person does so under the authority of a licence granted under section 10I(1).

statutoryNote.content:
Note—
A person may also do a particular act that is otherwise prohibited by this Part if the person does so under the authority of a licence granted (other than under section 10I(1)) to allow the person to do the particular act.

division.name: D2
division.heading: Supply, Sale, Transfer or Carriage of Items to DPRK

section.name: s2
section.heading: Prohibition against supply, sale or transfer of supply-sanctioned items

subsection.name: 1A
subsection.leadIn: This section applies to—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: a person acting in the HKSAR; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: a person acting outside the HKSAR who is—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: both a Hong Kong permanent resident and a Chinese national; or

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: a body incorporated or constituted under the law of the HKSAR. (L.N. 5 of 2010)

subsection.leadIn: Except under the authority of a licence granted under section 10J(1)(a), a person must not supply, sell or transfer, or agree to supply, sell or transfer, directly or indirectly, or do any act likely to promote the supply, sale or transfer of, any supply-sanctioned item (other than aviation fuel)— (L.N. 115 of 2014; L.N. 122 of 2018)

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: to the DPRK;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: to, or to the order of, a person connected with the DPRK; or

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: to a destination or person for the purpose of delivery or transfer, directly or indirectly to the DPRK or to, or to the order of, a person connected with the DPRK. (L.N. 5 of 2010)

subsection.name: 1B
subsection.leadIn: Except under the authority of a licence granted under section 10J(6)(a) and subject to subsection (1C), a person must not supply, sell or transfer, or agree to supply, sell or transfer, directly or indirectly, or do any act likely to promote the supply, sale or transfer of, aviation fuel—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: to the DPRK; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: to a destination or person for the purpose of delivery or transfer, directly or indirectly to the DPRK. (L.N. 122 of 2018)

subsection.name: 1C
subsection.content: Subsection (1B) does not apply if the aviation fuel is supplied, sold or transferred to a civilian passenger aircraft outside the DPRK exclusively for consumption during its flight to the DPRK and its return flight. (L.N. 122 of 2018)

subsection.leadIn: A person who contravenes subsection (1) or (1B) commits an offence and is liable— (L.N. 122 of 2018)

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: on conviction on indictment—to a fine and to imprisonment for 7 years; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: on summary conviction—to a fine at level 6 and to imprisonment for 6 months.

subsection.leadIn: It is a defence for a person charged with an offence under subsection (2) to prove that the person did not know and had no reason to believe— (L.N. 5 of 2010)

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: for a contravention of subsection (1) or (1B)—that the item concerned was a supply-sanctioned item; (L.N. 122 of 2018)

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: for a contravention of subsection (1)—that the item concerned was, or was to be, supplied, sold or transferred— (L.N. 122 of 2018)

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: to the DPRK;

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: to, or to the order of, a person connected with the DPRK; or

subparagraph.name: iii
subparagraph.content: to a destination or person for the purpose of delivery or transfer, directly or indirectly to the DPRK or to, or to the order of, a person connected with the DPRK; or (L.N. 5 of 2010)

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.leadIn: for a contravention of subsection (1B)—that the item concerned was, or was to be, supplied, sold or transferred—

subparagraph.content: to the DPRK; or
to a destination or person for the purpose of delivery or transfer, directly or indirectly to the DPRK. (L.N. 122 of 2018)

section.name: s2A
section.heading: Prohibition against supply, sale or transfer of luxury goods

subsection.leadIn: This section applies to—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: a person acting in the HKSAR; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: a person acting outside the HKSAR who is—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: both a Hong Kong permanent resident and a Chinese national; or

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: a body incorporated or constituted under the law of the HKSAR.

subsection.leadIn: Subject to section 3B, if a person knows or has reason to believe that—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: an item is luxury goods; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the item is to be supplied, sold or transferred to a place in the DPRK,

subsection.continued: the person must not, directly or indirectly, supply, sell or transfer the item.

subsection.leadIn: A person who contravenes subsection (2) commits an offence and is liable—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: on conviction on indictment—to a fine and to imprisonment for 7 years; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: on summary conviction—to a fine at level 6 and to imprisonment for 6 months. (L.N. 122 of 2018)

section.name: s3
section.heading: Prohibition against carriage of supply-sanctioned items

subsection.leadIn: This section applies to—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: a ship that is registered in the HKSAR;

paragraph.name: aa
b
paragraph.content: an aircraft that is registered in the HKSAR;

paragraph.name: ba
c
paragraph.leadIn: any other ship or aircraft that is for the time being chartered to a person who is—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: in the HKSAR;

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: both a Hong Kong permanent resident and a Chinese national; or

subparagraph.name: iii
subparagraph.content: a body incorporated or constituted under the law of the HKSAR; and

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: a vehicle in the HKSAR.

subsection.leadIn: Except under the authority of a licence granted under section 10J(1)(b), a ship, aircraft or vehicle must not be used for the carriage of any supply-sanctioned item (other than aviation fuel) if the carriage is, or forms part of, a carriage— (L.N. 5 of 2010; L.N. 115 of 2014; L.N. 122 of 2018)

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: from a place outside the DPRK to a place in the DPRK;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: to, or to the order of, a person connected with the DPRK; or

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: to a destination for the purpose of delivery or transfer, directly or indirectly to the DPRK or to, or to the order of, a person connected with the DPRK. (L.N. 5 of 2010)

subsection.name: 2AA
subsection.leadIn: Except under the authority of a licence granted under section 10J(6)(b) and subject to subsection (2AAB), a ship, aircraft or vehicle must not be used for the carriage of aviation fuel if the carriage is, or forms part of, a carriage—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: from a place outside the DPRK to a place in the DPRK; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: to a destination for the purpose of delivery or transfer, directly or indirectly to the DPRK. (L.N. 122 of 2018)

subsection.name: 2AAB
subsection.content: Subsection (2AA) does not apply if the aviation fuel is carried by a civilian passenger aircraft exclusively for consumption during its flight to the DPRK and its return flight. (L.N. 122 of 2018)

subsection.name: 2A
subsection.leadIn: If a ship, aircraft or vehicle is used in contravention of subsection (2) or (2AA), each of the following persons commits an offence— (L.N. 122 of 2018)

paragraph.name: a
b
paragraph.leadIn: for any other ship— (L.N. 54 of 2013)

subparagraph.name: i
ii
subparagraph.content: the operator of the ship, if the operator is in the HKSAR, or is both a Hong Kong permanent resident and a Chinese national, or is a body incorporated or constituted under the law of the HKSAR; and

subparagraph.name: iii
subparagraph.content: the master of the ship, if the master is in the HKSAR or is both a Hong Kong permanent resident and a Chinese national;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: for an aircraft registered in the HKSAR—the charterer, the operator and the pilot in command of the aircraft;

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.leadIn: for any other aircraft— (L.N. 54 of 2013)

subparagraph.name: i
ii
subparagraph.content: the operator of the aircraft, if the operator is in the HKSAR, or is both a Hong Kong permanent resident and a Chinese national, or is a body incorporated or constituted under the law of the HKSAR; and

subparagraph.name: iii

paragraph.name: e
paragraph.content: for a vehicle—the operator and the driver of the vehicle. (L.N. 5 of 2010; L.N. 54 of 2013)

subsection.leadIn: A person who commits an offence under subsection (2A) is liable— (L.N. 5 of 2010)

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: on conviction on indictment—to a fine and to imprisonment for 7 years; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: on summary conviction—to a fine at level 6 and to imprisonment for 6 months.

subsection.leadIn: It is a defence for a person charged with an offence under subsection (2A) to prove that the person did not know and had no reason to believe— (L.N. 5 of 2010)

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: for a contravention of subsection (2) or (2AA)—that the item concerned was a supply-sanctioned item; (L.N. 122 of 2018)

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: for a contravention of subsection (2)—that the carriage of the item concerned was, or formed part of, a carriage— (L.N. 5 of 2010; L.N. 122 of 2018)

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: from a place outside the DPRK to a place in the DPRK;

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: to, or to the order of, a person connected with the DPRK; or

subparagraph.name: iii
subparagraph.content: to a destination for the purpose of delivery or transfer, directly or indirectly to the DPRK or to, or to the order of, a person connected with the DPRK; or (L.N. 5 of 2010)

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.leadIn: for a contravention of subsection (2AA)—that the carriage of the item concerned was, or formed part of, a carriage—

subparagraph.content: from a place outside the DPRK to a place in the DPRK; or
to a destination for the purpose of delivery or transfer, directly or indirectly to the DPRK. (L.N. 122 of 2018)

section.name: s3AA
section.heading: Prohibition against carriage of luxury goods

subsection.leadIn: This section applies to—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: a ship that is registered in the HKSAR;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: a ship that is not registered in the HKSAR and is within the waters of Hong Kong;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: an aircraft that is registered in the HKSAR;

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: an aircraft that is not registered in the HKSAR and is within Hong Kong air space;

paragraph.name: e
paragraph.leadIn: any other ship or aircraft that is for the time being chartered to a person who is—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: in the HKSAR;

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: both a Hong Kong permanent resident and a Chinese national; or

subparagraph.name: iii
subparagraph.content: a body incorporated or constituted under the law of the HKSAR; and

paragraph.name: f
paragraph.content: a vehicle in the HKSAR.

subsection.leadIn: Subject to section 3B, a person specified in subsection (4) commits an offence if—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: a ship, aircraft or vehicle is used for the carriage of luxury goods;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the carriage is, or forms part of, a carriage referred to in subsection (3); and

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.leadIn: at the time when the ship, aircraft or vehicle is so used, the person knows or has reason to believe that—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: the item concerned is luxury goods; and

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: the carriage of the item concerned is, or forms part of, a carriage referred to in subsection (3).

subsection.leadIn: The carriage is a carriage of the item concerned—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: from a place outside the DPRK to a place in the DPRK; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: to a destination for the purpose of delivery or transfer, directly or indirectly to a place in the DPRK.

subsection.leadIn: The person is—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: for a ship registered in the HKSAR—the charterer, the operator or the master of the ship;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: for any other ship—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: the charterer of the ship, if the charterer is in the HKSAR, or is both a Hong Kong permanent resident and a Chinese national, or is a body incorporated or constituted under the law of the HKSAR;

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: the operator of the ship, if the operator is in the HKSAR, or is both a Hong Kong permanent resident and a Chinese national, or is a body incorporated or constituted under the law of the HKSAR; or

subparagraph.name: iii
subparagraph.content: the master of the ship, if the master is in the HKSAR or is both a Hong Kong permanent resident and a Chinese national;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: for an aircraft registered in the HKSAR—the charterer, the operator or the pilot in command of the aircraft;

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.leadIn: for any other aircraft—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: the charterer of the aircraft, if the charterer is in the HKSAR, or is both a Hong Kong permanent resident and a Chinese national, or is a body incorporated or constituted under the law of the HKSAR;

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: the operator of the aircraft, if the operator is in the HKSAR, or is both a Hong Kong permanent resident and a Chinese national, or is a body incorporated or constituted under the law of the HKSAR; or

subparagraph.name: iii
subparagraph.content: the pilot in command of the aircraft, if the pilot in command is in the HKSAR or is both a Hong Kong permanent resident and a Chinese national; or

paragraph.name: e
paragraph.content: for a vehicle—the operator or the driver of the vehicle.

subsection.leadIn: A person who commits an offence under subsection (2) is liable—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: on conviction on indictment—to a fine and to imprisonment for 7 years; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: on summary conviction—to a fine at level 6 and to imprisonment for 6 months.

section.name: s3B
section.heading: Exceptions to prohibitions under sections 2A and 3AA

subsection.content: Section 2A does not apply if the luxury goods is supplied, sold or transferred for the purposes of the activities of a diplomatic mission in the DPRK pursuant to the Vienna Convention on Diplomatic Relations of 18 April 1961.

Section 3AA does not apply if the carriage of the luxury goods is made for the purposes of the activities of a diplomatic mission in the DPRK pursuant to the Vienna Convention on Diplomatic Relations of 18 April 1961.

division.name: D3
division.heading: Procurement of Items or Services from DPRK

section.name: s4
section.heading: Prohibition against procurement of procurement-sanctioned items or certain services by certain persons

subsection.name: 1A
subsection.leadIn: This section applies to—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: a person acting in the HKSAR; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: a person acting outside the HKSAR who is—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: both a Hong Kong permanent resident and a Chinese national; or

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: a body incorporated or constituted under the law of the HKSAR. (L.N. 5 of 2010)

subsection.leadIn: Except under the authority of a licence granted under section 10K(1)(a), a person must not procure, agree to procure, directly or indirectly, or do any act likely to promote the procurement of any procurement-sanctioned item— (L.N. 122 of 2018)

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: from the DPRK; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: from a person connected with the DPRK. (L.N. 5 of 2010)

subsection.leadIn: A person who contravenes subsection (1) commits an offence and is liable—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: on conviction on indictment—to a fine and to imprisonment for 7 years; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: on summary conviction—to a fine at level 6 and to imprisonment for 6 months. (L.N. 122 of 2018)

subsection.leadIn: It is a defence for a person charged with an offence under subsection (2) to prove that the person did not know and had no reason to believe— (L.N. 5 of 2010)

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: that the item concerned was a procurement-sanctioned item; or (L.N. 122 of 2018)

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: that the item concerned was—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: from the DPRK; or

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: from a person connected with the DPRK.

subsection.name: 3A
subsection.leadIn: A person must not procure, agree to procure, directly or indirectly, or do any act likely to promote the procurement of any technical training, service (including brokering or other intermediary service), assistance or advice related to the provision, manufacture, maintenance or use of any specified arms— (L.N. 115 of 2014)

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: from the DPRK; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: from a person connected with the DPRK. (L.N. 5 of 2010)

subsection.name: 3B
subsection.leadIn: A person who contravenes subsection (3A) commits an offence and is liable—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: on conviction on indictment—to a fine and to imprisonment for 7 years; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: on summary conviction—to a fine at level 6 and to imprisonment for 6 months. (L.N. 5 of 2010; L.N. 122 of 2018)

subsection.name: 3C
subsection.leadIn: It is a defence for a person charged with an offence under subsection (3B) to prove that the person did not know and had no reason to believe—

paragraph.name: a
b
paragraph.content: that the technical training, service, assistance or advice concerned was, or was to be, procured from the DPRK or a person connected with the DPRK. (L.N. 5 of 2010; L.N. 122 of 2018)

section.name: s5
section.heading: Prohibition against procurement of procurement-sanctioned items or certain services using ships, aircraft or vehicles

subsection.leadIn: This section applies to—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: a ship that is registered in the HKSAR;

paragraph.name: aa
paragraph.content: a ship that is not registered in the HKSAR and is within the waters of Hong Kong; (L.N. 5 of 2010)

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: an aircraft that is registered in the HKSAR;

paragraph.name: ba
paragraph.content: an aircraft that is not registered in the HKSAR and is within Hong Kong air space; (L.N. 5 of 2010)

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.leadIn: any other ship or aircraft that is for the time being chartered to a person who is—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: in the HKSAR;

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: both a Hong Kong permanent resident and a Chinese national; or

subparagraph.name: iii
subparagraph.content: a body incorporated or constituted under the law of the HKSAR; and

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: a vehicle in the HKSAR.

subsection.leadIn: Without limiting section 4, a ship, aircraft or vehicle must not be used for or in connection with the procurement of—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: (except under the authority of a licence granted under section 10K(1)(b)) any procurement-sanctioned item— (L.N. 122 of 2018)

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: from the DPRK; or

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: from a person connected with the DPRK; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: any technical training, service (including brokering or other intermediary service), assistance or advice related to the provision, manufacture, maintenance or use of any specified arms— ( L.N. 115 of 2014)

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: from the DPRK; or

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: from a person connected with the DPRK. (L.N. 5 of 2010)

subsection.name: 2A
subsection.leadIn: If a ship, aircraft or vehicle is used in contravention of subsection (2), each of the following persons commits an offence—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: for a ship registered in the HKSAR—the charterer, the operator and the master of the ship;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: for any other ship— (L.N. 54 of 2013)

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: the charterer of the ship, if the charterer is in the HKSAR, or is both a Hong Kong permanent resident and a Chinese national, or is a body incorporated or constituted under the law of the HKSAR;

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: the operator of the ship, if the operator is in the HKSAR, or is both a Hong Kong permanent resident and a Chinese national, or is a body incorporated or constituted under the law of the HKSAR; and

subparagraph.name: iii
subparagraph.content: the master of the ship, if the master is in the HKSAR or is both a Hong Kong permanent resident and a Chinese national;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: for an aircraft registered in the HKSAR—the charterer, the operator and the pilot in command of the aircraft;

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.leadIn: for any other aircraft— (L.N. 54 of 2013)

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: the charterer of the aircraft, if the charterer is in the HKSAR, or is both a Hong Kong permanent resident and a Chinese national, or is a body incorporated or constituted under the law of the HKSAR;

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: the operator of the aircraft, if the operator is in the HKSAR, or is both a Hong Kong permanent resident and a Chinese national, or is a body incorporated or constituted under the law of the HKSAR; and

subparagraph.name: iii
subparagraph.content: the pilot in command of the aircraft, if the pilot in command is in the HKSAR or is both a Hong Kong permanent resident and a Chinese national;

paragraph.name: e
paragraph.content: for a vehicle—the operator and the driver of the vehicle. (L.N. 5 of 2010; L.N. 54 of 2013; L.N. 122 of 2018)

subsection.leadIn: A person who commits an offence under subsection (2A) is liable— (L.N. 5 of 2010)

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: on conviction on indictment—to a fine and to imprisonment for 7 years; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: on summary conviction—to a fine at level 6 and to imprisonment for 6 months. (L.N. 122 of 2018)

subsection.leadIn: It is a defence for a person charged with an offence under subsection (2A) to prove that the person did not know and had no reason to believe—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: for a contravention of subsection (2)(a)—that the item concerned—

subparagraph.content: was a procurement-sanctioned item; or
was from the DPRK or a person connected with the DPRK; or (L.N. 122 of 2018)

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: for a contravention of subsection (2)(b)—that the technical training, service, assistance or advice concerned—

subparagraph.content: related to the provision, manufacture, maintenance or use of any specified arms; or
was, or was to be, procured from the DPRK or a person connected with the DPRK. (L.N. 122 of 2018)

section.name: s5AA
section.heading: Prohibition against procurement of ship or aircraft crewing service

subsection.leadIn: This section applies to a person (whether acting in or outside the HKSAR) who is—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: both a Hong Kong permanent resident and a Chinese national; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: a body incorporated or constituted under the law of the HKSAR.

subsection.leadIn: A person must not procure, agree to procure, directly or indirectly, or do any act likely to promote the procurement of any ship or aircraft crewing service—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: from the DPRK; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: from a person connected with the DPRK.

subsection.leadIn: A person who contravenes subsection (2) commits an offence and is liable—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: on conviction on indictment—to a fine and to imprisonment for 7 years; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: on summary conviction—to a fine at level 6 and to imprisonment for 6 months.

subsection.content: It is a defence for a person charged with an offence under subsection (3) to prove that the person did not know and had no reason to believe that the ship or aircraft crewing service concerned was, or was to be, procured from the DPRK or a person connected with the DPRK.

section.name: s5A
section.heading: Prohibition against engaging in certain financial transactions

subsection.leadIn: This section applies to—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: a person acting in the HKSAR; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: a person acting outside the HKSAR who is—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: both a Hong Kong permanent resident and a Chinese national; or

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: a body incorporated or constituted under the law of the HKSAR.

subsection.content: A person must not engage, directly or indirectly, in any financial transaction related to the provision, manufacture, maintenance or use of any specified arms the supply, sale, transfer or carriage of which is prohibited under section 2 or 3.

A person must not engage, directly or indirectly, in any financial transaction related to the provision, manufacture, maintenance or use of any specified arms the procurement of which is prohibited under section 4.

subsection.leadIn: A person who contravenes subsection (2) or (3) commits an offence and is liable—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: on conviction on indictment—to a fine and to imprisonment for 7 years; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: on summary conviction—to a fine at level 6 and to imprisonment for 6 months.

subsection.leadIn: It is a defence for a person charged with an offence under subsection (4) to prove that the person did not know and had no reason to believe—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: for a contravention of subsection (2) or (3)—that the financial transaction concerned related to the provision, manufacture, maintenance or use of any specified arms;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: for a contravention of subsection (2)—that the supply, sale, transfer or carriage of the arms concerned was prohibited under section 2 or 3; or

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: for a contravention of subsection (3)—that the procurement of the arms concerned was prohibited under section 4.

section.name: s5C
section.heading: Prohibition against provision of financial services or transfer of funds, etc.

subsection.content: A regulated person must not provide, directly or indirectly, any financial services that could contribute to a prohibited programme or activity.
A regulated person must not transfer, directly or indirectly, any funds or other financial assets or economic resources that could contribute to a prohibited programme or activity.
A regulated person must not accept, directly or indirectly, the transfer of any funds or other financial assets or economic resources that could contribute to a prohibited programme or activity.

A regulated person must not make available, or deal with, directly or indirectly, any funds or other financial assets or economic resources if the funds, financial assets or economic resources are associated with a prohibited programme or activity.

subsection.leadIn: A person who contravenes subsection (1), (2), (3) or (4) commits an offence and is liable—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: on conviction on indictment—to a fine and to imprisonment for 7 years; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: on summary conviction—to a fine at level 6 and to imprisonment for 6 months. (L.N. 122 of 2018)

subsection.leadIn: It is a defence for a person charged with an offence under subsection (5) to prove that the person did not know and had no reason to believe—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: for a contravention of subsection (1)—that the financial services concerned could contribute to a prohibited programme or activity;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: for a contravention of subsection (2)—that the funds or other financial assets or economic resources concerned could contribute to a prohibited programme or activity;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: for a contravention of subsection (3)—that the funds or other financial assets or economic resources concerned could contribute to a prohibited programme or activity;

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: for a contravention of subsection (4)—that the funds or other financial assets or economic resources concerned were associated with a prohibited programme or activity. (L.N. 122 of 2018)

subsection.leadIn: A person is not to be regarded as having contravened subsection (1), (2), (3) or (4) by reason only of having credited an account described in subsection (8) with—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: interest or other earnings due on that account; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: payment due under contracts, agreements or obligations that arose before the date on which this section comes into operation.

subsection.content: The account is an account in which the funds or other financial assets or economic resources are kept.

subsection.leadIn: In this section—

def.name: ProhibitedProgrammeOrActivity
def.leadIn: prohibited programme or activity (禁制計劃或活動) means—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: DPRK’s nuclear or ballistic missile programme; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: any other activity that is prohibited by the Security Council Resolutions; (L.N. 122 of 2018)

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: a person acting in the HKSAR; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: a person acting outside the HKSAR who is—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: both a Hong Kong permanent resident and a Chinese national; or

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: a body incorporated or constituted under the law of the HKSAR.

section.name: s5D
section.heading: Prohibition against certain banking activities in HKSAR

subsection.content: A person connected with the DPRK must not carry on a banking business or a business of taking deposits in the HKSAR.
A DPRK bank must not establish or maintain an office in the HKSAR.

subsection.leadIn: A person who contravenes subsection (1) or (2) commits an offence and is liable—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: on conviction on indictment—to a fine and to imprisonment for 7 years; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: on summary conviction—to a fine at level 6 and to imprisonment for 6 months.

subsection.leadIn: In this section—
subsection.def: banking business (銀行業務) has the meaning given by section 2(1) of the Banking Ordinance (Cap. 155);
deposit (存款) has the meaning given by section 2(1) of the Banking Ordinance (Cap. 155).

section.name: s5E
section.heading: Prohibition against certain activities of financial institutions in DPRK or in connection with DPRK banks

subsection.leadIn: This section applies to—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: a financial institution acting in the HKSAR; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: a financial institution acting outside the HKSAR that is—

subparagraph.content: both a Hong Kong permanent resident and a Chinese national; or
a body incorporated or constituted under the law of the HKSAR.

subsection.leadIn: A financial institution must not—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: open or maintain a representative office, or establish or maintain a subsidiary or branch, in the DPRK; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: open or maintain a bank account in the DPRK.

subsection.leadIn: Except under the authority of a licence granted under section 10L(1), a financial institution must not—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: establish or maintain a joint venture with a DPRK bank;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: acquire or maintain an ownership interest in a DPRK bank; or

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: establish or maintain a correspondent banking relationship with a DPRK bank.

subsection.leadIn: A financial institution which contravenes subsection (2) or (3) commits an offence and is liable—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: on conviction on indictment—to a fine and to imprisonment for 7 years; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: on summary conviction—to a fine at level 6 and to imprisonment for 6 months.

subsection.content: It is a defence for a financial institution charged with an offence under subsection (4) for a contravention of subsection (3) to prove that the financial institution did not know and had no reason to believe that the bank concerned was a DPRK bank.

subsection.leadIn: In this section—

def.name: CorrespondentBankingRelationshipWithADPRKBank
def.leadIn: correspondent banking relationship with a DPRK bank (與朝鮮銀行的代理銀行關係), in relation to a financial institution, means a relationship involving—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the provision of banking services by the financial institution to a DPRK bank to enable the DPRK bank to provide services and products to the DPRK bank’s customers; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the provision of banking services by a DPRK bank to the financial institution to enable the financial institution to provide services and products to the financial institution’s customers.

section.name: s5F
section.heading: Prohibition against opening or maintaining certain bank accounts

subsection.leadIn: Except under the authority of a licence granted under section 10M(1), a financial institution must not open a new bank account, or maintain a bank account, for—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: a diplomatic mission or consular post of the DPRK; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: an accredited diplomat or consular officer of the DPRK.

subsection.leadIn: A financial institution which contravenes subsection (1) commits an offence and is liable—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: on conviction on indictment—to a fine and to imprisonment for 7 years; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: on summary conviction—to a fine at level 6 and to imprisonment for 6 months.

subsection.leadIn: It is a defence for a financial institution charged with an offence under subsection (2) to prove that the financial institution did not know and had no reason to believe that the person for whom the new bank account was opened, or the bank account was maintained, was—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: a diplomatic mission or consular post of the DPRK; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: an accredited diplomat or consular officer of the DPRK.

section.name: s5G
section.heading: Prohibition against provision of financial support for trade with persons connected with the DPRK

subsection.content: Except under the authority of a licence granted under section 10N(1), a regulated person must not provide financial support to any person for trade with a person connected with the DPRK.

subsection.leadIn: A regulated person who contravenes subsection (1) commits an offence and is liable—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: on conviction on indictment—to a fine and to imprisonment for 7 years; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: on summary conviction—to a fine at level 6 and to imprisonment for 6 months.

subsection.content: It is a defence for a regulated person charged with an offence under subsection (2) to prove that the regulated person did not know and had no reason to believe that the financial support was provided for trade with a person connected with the DPRK.

subsection.leadIn: In this section—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: export credit;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: guarantee; and

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: insurance;

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: a person acting in the HKSAR; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: a person acting outside the HKSAR who is—

subparagraph.content: both a Hong Kong permanent resident and a Chinese national; or
a body incorporated or constituted under the law of the HKSAR.

section.name: s6
section.heading: Prohibition against provision of technical training, services, etc. to certain persons

subsection.name: 1A
subsection.leadIn: This section applies to—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: a person acting in the HKSAR; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: a person acting outside the HKSAR who is—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: both a Hong Kong permanent resident and a Chinese national; or

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: a body incorporated or constituted under the law of the HKSAR. (L.N. 5 of 2010)

subsection.content: A person must not provide, directly or indirectly, to a person connected with the DPRK any technical training, service (including brokering or other intermediary service), assistance or advice related to the provision, manufacture, maintenance or use of any specified item. (L.N. 5 of 2010; L.N. 115 of 2014)

subsection.leadIn: A person who contravenes subsection (1) commits an offence and is liable—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: on conviction on indictment—to a fine and to imprisonment for 7 years; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: on summary conviction—to a fine at level 6 and to imprisonment for 6 months.

subsection.leadIn: It is a defence for a person charged with an offence under subsection (2) to prove that the person did not know and had no reason to believe—

paragraph.name: a
b
paragraph.content: that the technical training, service, assistance or advice concerned was, or was to be, provided to a person connected with the DPRK. (L.N. 5 of 2010)

section.name: s7
section.heading: Prohibition against acceptance of technical training, services, etc. provided by certain persons

subsection.name: 1A
subsection.leadIn: This section applies to—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: a person acting in the HKSAR; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: a person acting outside the HKSAR who is—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: both a Hong Kong permanent resident and a Chinese national; or

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: a body incorporated or constituted under the law of the HKSAR. (L.N. 5 of 2010)

subsection.content: A person must not accept, directly or indirectly, any technical training, service (including brokering or other intermediary service), assistance or advice that is provided by a DPRK-related person and related to the provision, manufacture, maintenance or use of any specified item. (L.N. 5 of 2010; L.N. 115 of 2014)
A person who contravenes subsection (1) commits an offence and is liable—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: on conviction on indictment—to a fine and to imprisonment for 7 years; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: on summary conviction—to a fine at level 6 and to imprisonment for 6 months. (L.N. 122 of 2018)

subsection.content: It is a defence for a person charged with an offence under subsection (2) to prove that the person did not know and had no reason to believe—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: that the technical training, service, assistance or advice concerned related to the provision, manufacture, maintenance or use of any specified item; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: that the technical training, service, assistance or advice concerned was, or was to be, provided by a DPRK-related person. (L.N. 5 of 2010; L.N. 115 of 2014; L.N. 122 of 2018)

subsection.leadIn: In this section—

def.name: DPRKrelatedPerson
def.leadIn: DPRK-related person (關乎朝鮮人士) means—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: a person connected with the DPRK; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: a national of the DPRK who is in a place outside the DPRK. (L.N. 115 of 2014)

section.name: s7A
section.heading: Prohibition against provision of certain specialized teaching and training

subsection.leadIn: This section applies to—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: a person acting in the HKSAR; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: a person acting outside the HKSAR who is—

subparagraph.content: both a Hong Kong permanent resident and a Chinese national; or
a body incorporated or constituted under the law of the HKSAR.

subsection.content: A person must not provide any specified teaching or training to a national of the DPRK.

subsection.leadIn: A person who contravenes subsection (2) commits an offence and is liable—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: on conviction on indictment—to a fine and to imprisonment for 7 years; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: on summary conviction—to a fine at level 6 and to imprisonment for 6 months.

subsection.leadIn: It is a defence for a person charged with an offence under subsection (3) to prove that the person did not know and had no reason to believe—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: that the teaching or training concerned was specified teaching or training; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: that the person to whom the teaching or training concerned was provided was a national of the DPRK.

subsection.leadIn: In this section—

def.name: SpecifiedTeachingOrTraining
def.leadIn: specified teaching or training (指明教學或培訓) means specialized teaching or training that could contribute to the DPRK’s proliferation of sensitive nuclear activities or the DPRK’s development of nuclear weapon delivery systems, including teaching or training in—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: advanced physics;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: advanced computer simulation and related computer sciences;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: geospatial navigation;

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: nuclear engineering;

paragraph.name: e
paragraph.content: aerospace engineering;

paragraph.name: f
paragraph.content: aeronautical engineering;

paragraph.name: g
paragraph.content: advanced materials science;

paragraph.name: h
paragraph.content: advanced chemical engineering;
advanced mechanical engineering;

paragraph.name: j
paragraph.content: advanced electrical engineering;

paragraph.name: k
paragraph.content: advanced industrial engineering; or
any related discipline.

section.name: s7B
section.heading: Prohibition against engaging in certain scientific or technical co-operation

subsection.leadIn: This section applies to—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: a person acting in the HKSAR; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: a person acting outside the HKSAR who is—

subparagraph.content: both a Hong Kong permanent resident and a Chinese national; or
a body incorporated or constituted under the law of the HKSAR.

subsection.content: Except under the authority of a licence granted under section 10O(1), a person must not engage in any scientific or technical co-operation involving a person officially sponsored by the DPRK or a person representing the DPRK, except for medical exchanges.

subsection.leadIn: A person who contravenes subsection (2) commits an offence and is liable—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: on conviction on indictment—to a fine and to imprisonment for 7 years; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: on summary conviction—to a fine at level 6 and to imprisonment for 6 months.

subsection.content: It is a defence for a person charged with an offence under subsection (3) to prove that the person did not know and had no reason to believe that the scientific or technical co-operation concerned involved a person officially sponsored by the DPRK or a person representing the DPRK.

division.name: D6
division.heading: Making Available or Dealing with Funds etc.

section.name: s8
section.heading: Prohibition against making available funds, etc. or dealing with funds, etc.

subsection.name: 1A
subsection.leadIn: This section applies to—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: a person acting in the HKSAR; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: a person acting outside the HKSAR who is—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: both a Hong Kong permanent resident and a Chinese national; or

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: a body incorporated or constituted under the law of the HKSAR. (L.N. 5 of 2010)

subsection.leadIn: Except under the authority of a licence granted under section 11(1)— (L.N. 122 of 2018)

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: a person must not make available, directly or indirectly, any funds or other financial assets or economic resources to, or for the benefit of, a relevant person or a relevant entity; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.def: a person (first-mentioned person) must not deal with, directly or indirectly, any funds or other financial assets or economic resources belonging to, or owned or controlled by, a relevant person or a relevant entity, and if the first-mentioned person is a relevant person or a relevant entity, including any funds and other financial assets or economic resources belonging to, or owned or controlled by, the first-mentioned person. (L.N. 115 of 2014)

subsection.leadIn: A person who contravenes subsection (1) commits an offence and is liable—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: on conviction on indictment—to a fine and to imprisonment for 7 years; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: on summary conviction—to a fine at level 6 and to imprisonment for 6 months. (L.N. 122 of 2018)

subsection.leadIn: It is a defence for a person charged with an offence under subsection (2) to prove that the person did not know and had no reason to believe— (L.N. 122 of 2018)

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: for a contravention of subsection (1)(a)—that the funds or other financial assets or economic resources concerned were, or were to be, made available to, or for the benefit of, a relevant person or a relevant entity; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: for a contravention of subsection (1)(b)—that the person was dealing with funds or other financial assets or economic resources belonging to, or owned or controlled by, a relevant person or a relevant entity. (L.N. 5 of 2010; L.N. 115 of 2014; L.N. 122 of 2018)

subsection.leadIn: A person is not to be regarded as having contravened subsection (1) by reason only of having credited an account belonging to, or owned or controlled by, a relevant person or a relevant entity with— (L.N. 115 of 2014)

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: interest or other earnings due on that account; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: payment due under contracts, agreements or obligations that arose before the date on which the person or entity became a relevant person or a relevant entity. (L.N. 5 of 2010; L.N. 140 of 2012)

def.name: DealWith
def.leadIn: In this section, deal with (處理) means—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: in respect of funds—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: use, alter, move, allow access to or transfer;

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: deal with in any other way that would result in any change in volume, amount, location, ownership, possession, character or destination; or

subparagraph.name: iii
subparagraph.content: make any other change that would enable use, including portfolio management; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: in respect of other financial assets or economic resources—use to obtain funds, goods or services in any way, including by selling, hiring or mortgaging the assets or resources. (L.N. 5 of 2010; L.N. 122 of 2018)

section.name: s9
section.heading: Prohibition against entry or transit by certain persons

subsection.content: Subject to section 10, a specified person must not enter or transit through the HKSAR. (L.N. 5 of 2010; L.N. 115 of 2014)
A person who contravenes subsection (1) commits an offence and is liable on conviction to a fine at level 4 and to imprisonment for 2 years.
This section does not apply to a person having the right of abode or the right to land in the HKSAR. (L.N. 5 of 2010)

subsection.leadIn: In this section—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: a person designated by the Committee or the Security Council for the purposes of paragraph 8(e) of Resolution 1718; or (L.N. 122 of 2018)

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: a person acting on behalf of, or at the direction of, a person mentioned in paragraph (a). (L.N. 122 of 2018)

section.name: s10
section.heading: Exceptions to prohibition against entry or transit by certain persons
section.leadIn: Section 9 does not apply to a case in respect of which—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the Committee has determined that the relevant entry or transit is justified on the ground of humanitarian need, including religious obligation; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the Committee has determined that the relevant entry or transit would otherwise further the objectives of Resolution 1718.

section.name: s10A
section.heading: Prohibition against certain activities in connection with ships and aircraft

subsection.leadIn: This section applies to—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: a person acting in the HKSAR; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: a person acting outside the HKSAR who is—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: both a Hong Kong permanent resident and a Chinese national; or

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: a body incorporated or constituted under the law of the HKSAR.

subsection.content: Subject to section 10B(1), a person must not provide, directly or indirectly, any specified services to a ship registered in the DPRK if the person knows or has reasonable grounds to believe that the ship is carrying a prohibited item. (L.N. 122 of 2018)

subsection.name: 2A
subsection.leadIn: Except under the authority of a licence granted under section 11A(1), a person must not—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: lease or charter a ship or aircraft that is registered in the HKSAR to a relevant person, relevant entity or person connected with the DPRK;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: provide a ship or aircraft crewing service to a relevant person, relevant entity or person connected with the DPRK;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: register a ship in the DPRK;

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: obtain an authorization for a ship to use the flag of the DPRK;

paragraph.name: e
paragraph.content: own, lease, charter or operate a ship registered in the DPRK;

paragraph.name: f
paragraph.content: provide a ship classification, certification or associated service to a ship registered in the DPRK; or

paragraph.name: g
paragraph.content: insure a ship registered in the DPRK. (L.N. 122 of 2018)

subsection.name: 2B
subsection.leadIn: Except under the authority of a licence granted under section 11A(3), a person must not provide an insurance or reinsurance service to—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: a ship owned, controlled or operated by a person connected with the DPRK; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: a ship that is involved in an activity prohibited by the Security Council Resolutions. (L.N. 122 of 2018)

subsection.name: 2C
subsection.leadIn: Except under the authority of a licence granted under section 11A(5), a person must not provide a ship classification service to a ship if—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: the ship—

subparagraph.content: was registered in the HKSAR and the registration was closed under section 64(6) of the Merchant Shipping (Registration) Ordinance (Cap. 415); or
was registered in a place outside the HKSAR and the registration was closed (however described) by the authority of that place; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the closure of registration was related to the ship’s involvement in an activity prohibited by the Security Council Resolutions. (L.N. 122 of 2018)

subsection.name: 2D
subsection.content: Subject to section 10B(2), a person must not, directly or indirectly, deal with a relevant ship. (L.N. 122 of 2018)

subsection.leadIn: A person who contravenes subsection (2), (2A), (2B), (2C) or (2D) commits an offence and is liable— (L.N. 122 of 2018)

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: on conviction on indictment—to a fine and to imprisonment for 7 years; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: on summary conviction—to a fine at level 6 and to imprisonment for 6 months. (L.N. 122 of 2018)

subsection.name: 3A
subsection.leadIn: It is a defence for a person charged with an offence under subsection (3) to prove that the person did not know and had no reason to believe—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: for a contravention of subsection (2A)(a) or (b)—that the person to whom the ship or aircraft was leased or chartered, or to whom the crewing service was provided, was a relevant person, relevant entity or person connected with the DPRK;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: for a contravention of subsection (2A)(e), (f) or (g)—that the ship concerned was registered in the DPRK;

paragraph.name: c
d
e
paragraph.leadIn: for a contravention of subsection (2C)—

subparagraph.content: that the registration of the ship concerned was closed; or
that the closure of registration was related to the ship’s involvement in an activity prohibited by the Security Council Resolutions; or

paragraph.name: f
paragraph.content: for a contravention of subsection (2D)—that the ship concerned was a relevant ship. (L.N. 122 of 2018)

subsection.leadIn: In this section— (L.N. 122 of 2018)

def.name: DealWith
def.leadIn: deal with (處理), in relation to a ship, means—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: use (including use to obtain funds, goods or services in any way, such as by selling, hiring, chartering or mortgaging the ship);

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: alter, allow access to or transfer;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: deal with in any other way that would result in any change in location, ownership, possession, character or destination; or

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: make any other change that would enable use; (L.N. 122 of 2018)

subsection.def: relevant ship (相關船舶) means a ship named in the list published under section 31A(1); (L.N. 122 of 2018)

def.name: SpecifiedServices
def.leadIn: specified services (指明服務), in relation to a ship, means the provision of any bunkering service to the ship or any of the following services— (L.N. 122 of 2018)

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the provision of fuel to the ship;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the provision of tools or equipment for shipboard maintenance;

paragraph.name: c
d
paragraph.content: the servicing or repair of any part of the ship or any item referred to in paragraphs (b) and (c).

section.name: s10B
section.heading: Exception to prohibition under section 10A

subsection.content: Section 10A(2) does not apply if the provision of the specified services concerned is necessary for humanitarian purposes. (L.N. 122 of 2018)

subsection.leadIn: Section 10A(2D) does not apply if the ship concerned is dealt with in accordance with—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: for a ship registered in the HKSAR—a direction given by the Director of Marine under section 10E(1); or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: for a ship registered in a place outside the HKSAR—a direction given by the authority of that place for the purposes of paragraph 12(b) of Resolution 2321. (L.N. 122 of 2018)

section.name: s10D
section.heading: Prohibition against ship-to-ship transfer

subsection.leadIn: Subsection (2) applies to—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: a person acting in the HKSAR; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: a person acting outside the HKSAR who is—

subparagraph.content: both a Hong Kong permanent resident and a Chinese national; or
a body incorporated or constituted under the law of the HKSAR.

subsection.content: A person must not facilitate or engage in a ship-to-ship transfer to or from a ship registered in the DPRK of any item that is being supplied, sold or transferred to or from the DPRK.

subsection.leadIn: A person who contravenes subsection (2) commits an offence and is liable—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: on conviction on indictment—to a fine and to imprisonment for 7 years; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: on summary conviction—to a fine at level 6 and to imprisonment for 6 months.

subsection.content: A ship registered in the HKSAR must not be used for facilitating or engaging in a ship-to-ship transfer to or from a ship registered in the DPRK of any item that is being supplied, sold or transferred to or from the DPRK.
If a ship registered in the HKSAR is used in contravention of subsection (4), the charterer, the operator and the master of the ship each commits an offence.

subsection.leadIn: A person who commits an offence under subsection (5) is liable—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: on conviction on indictment—to a fine and to imprisonment for 7 years; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: on summary conviction—to a fine at level 6 and to imprisonment for 6 months.

subsection.leadIn: It is a defence for a person charged with an offence under subsection (3) or (5) to prove that the person did not know and had no reason to believe—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: that the item concerned was being supplied, sold or transferred to or from the DPRK; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: that the ship concerned was registered in the DPRK.

section.name: s10E
section.heading: Director of Marine to give directions to certain ships

subsection.leadIn: If—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: a ship registered in the HKSAR is designated by the Committee for the purposes of paragraph 12 of Resolution 2321; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the Committee requires that the ship be directed to a port identified by the Committee,

subsection.continued: the Director of Marine must direct the ship to the port.

subsection.leadIn: Subsection (1) applies whether or not—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the ship is within the waters of Hong Kong; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the port to which the ship is directed is in the HKSAR.

subsection.leadIn: A charterer, operator or master of a ship who, without reasonable excuse, fails to comply with a direction given under subsection (1) commits an offence and is liable—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: on conviction on indictment—to a fine and to imprisonment for 7 years; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: on summary conviction—to a fine at level 6 and to imprisonment for 6 months.

section.name: s10F
section.heading: Prohibition against certain aircraft from taking off, landing and flying

subsection.leadIn: This section applies to—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: an aircraft that carries a supply-sanctioned item or luxury goods to the DPRK (except for a carriage under the authority of a licence, or a carriage referred to in section 3(2AAB) or 3B(2)); and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: an aircraft that carries a procurement-sanctioned item from the DPRK (except for a carriage under the authority of a licence).

subsection.leadIn: If the Director-General of Civil Aviation has information that provides reasonable grounds for the Director-General to believe that an aircraft is one to which this section applies, the Director-General must deny permission for the aircraft—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: to take off from the HKSAR;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: to land in the HKSAR, except in the circumstances specified in subsection (3); or

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: to fly within Hong Kong air space.

subsection.leadIn: An aircraft to which this section applies may land in the HKSAR—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: for the purpose of an inspection under section 17; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: in the case of an emergency.

subsection.leadIn: The pilot in command of an aircraft to which permission is denied under subsection (2) must not cause the aircraft—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: for subsection (2)(a)—to take off from the HKSAR;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: for subsection (2)(b)—to land in the HKSAR; or

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: for subsection (2)(c)—to fly within Hong Kong air space.

subsection.leadIn: A pilot in command who contravenes subsection (4) commits an offence and is liable—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: on conviction on indictment—to a fine and to imprisonment for 7 years; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: on summary conviction—to a fine at level 6 and to imprisonment for 6 months.

section.name: s10G
section.heading: Prohibition against certain activities in connection with immovable property

subsection.leadIn: A person must not—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: lease, or otherwise make available, immovable property, directly or indirectly, to the DPRK Government if the person knows or has reason to believe that the property is to be used for any purpose other than diplomatic or consular activities;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: lease immovable property, directly or indirectly, from the DPRK Government; or

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: subject to subsection (2), engage in any activity linked to the use of immovable property that the DPRK Government owns or leases.

subsection.leadIn: Subsection (1)(c) does not apply to the provision of goods and services which—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: are essential for the functioning of a diplomatic mission or consular post; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: cannot be used to generate income or profit, directly or indirectly, for the DPRK Government.

subsection.leadIn: A person who contravenes subsection (1) commits an offence and is liable—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: on conviction on indictment—to a fine and to imprisonment for 7 years; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: on summary conviction—to a fine at level 6 and to imprisonment for 6 months.

subsection.leadIn: It is a defence for a person charged with an offence under subsection (3) to prove that the person did not know and had no reason to believe—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: for a contravention of subsection (1)(a)—that the immovable property concerned was leased, or otherwise made available, to the DPRK Government;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: for a contravention of subsection (1)(b)—that the immovable property concerned was leased from the DPRK Government; or

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: for a contravention of subsection (1)(c)—that the activity concerned was linked to the use of immovable property that the DPRK Government owned or leased.

subsection.leadIn: In this section—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: an entity or body of the Government of the DPRK; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: a person acting on behalf of the Government of the DPRK.

section.name: s10H
section.heading: Prohibition against joint ventures or co-operative entities with persons connected with the DPRK

subsection.leadIn: This section applies to—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: a person acting in the HKSAR; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: a person acting outside the HKSAR who is—

subparagraph.content: both a Hong Kong permanent resident and a Chinese national; or
a body incorporated or constituted under the law of the HKSAR.

subsection.leadIn: Except under the authority of a licence granted under section 11B(1), a person must not—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: establish, maintain or operate a joint venture or co-operative entity with a person connected with the DPRK; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: invest in such a joint venture or co-operative entity.

subsection.leadIn: A person who contravenes subsection (2) commits an offence and is liable—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: on conviction on indictment—to a fine and to imprisonment for 7 years; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: on summary conviction—to a fine at level 6 and to imprisonment for 6 months.

subsection.content: It is a defence for a person charged with an offence under subsection (3) to prove that the person did not know and had no reason to believe that the joint venture or co-operative entity concerned was one with a person connected with the DPRK.

section.name: s10I
section.heading: General licence for all prohibited acts

subsection.content: If on application the Chief Executive determines that the requirement in subsection (2) is met, the Chief Executive must grant a licence for doing an act prohibited by any provision of Part 2 (whether or not the act is one for which a licence may be granted under another provision of this Part).

subsection.leadIn: The requirement is that the Committee determines that the act is—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: necessary to facilitate the work of international and non-governmental organizations carrying out assistance and relief activities in the DPRK for the benefit of the civilian population of the DPRK; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: for any other purpose consistent with the objectives of the Security Council Resolutions.

section.name: s10J
section.heading: Licence for supply, sale, transfer or carriage of certain supply-sanctioned items

subsection.leadIn: If on application the Chief Executive determines that the applicable requirements in subsection (2), (3), (4) or (5) are met, the Chief Executive must grant, as appropriate—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: a licence for the supply, sale or transfer of, or the doing of any act likely to promote the supply, sale or transfer of, a supply-sanctioned item referred to in the subsection concerned—

subparagraph.content: to the DPRK;
to, or to the order of, a person connected with the DPRK; or
to a destination or person for the purpose of delivery or transfer, directly or indirectly to the DPRK or to, or to the order of, a person connected with the DPRK; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: a licence for the carriage of a supply-sanctioned item referred to in the subsection concerned that is, or forms part of, a carriage—

subparagraph.content: from a place outside the DPRK to a place in the DPRK;
to, or to the order of, a person connected with the DPRK; or
to a destination for the purpose of delivery or transfer, directly or indirectly to the DPRK or to, or to the order of, a person connected with the DPRK.

subsection.content: For a new helicopter or a new or used ship, the applicable requirement is that the Committee has approved the supply, sale, transfer or carriage of the helicopter or ship in advance on a case-by-case basis.

subsection.leadIn: For a refined petroleum product, the applicable requirements are all of the following—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the supply, sale, transfer or carriage of the product will not result in the quota referred to in paragraph 5 of Resolution 2397 being exceeded;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: information about all parties to the supply, sale, transfer or carriage of the product has been given to the Chief Executive;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: the supply, sale, transfer or carriage of the product does not involve an individual or entity that is associated with the DPRK’s nuclear or ballistic missile programmes or other activities prohibited by the Security Council Resolutions (including a relevant person, a relevant entity, and an individual or entity assisting in the evasion of sanctions);

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: the supply, sale, transfer or carriage of the product is exclusively for livelihood purposes of the nationals of the DPRK and unrelated to generating revenue for the programmes or activities referred to in paragraph (c);

paragraph.name: e
paragraph.content: there is no instruction from the instructing authority not to allow the supply, sale, transfer or carriage of the product.

subsection.leadIn: For crude oil, the applicable requirement is either—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the Committee has approved in advance on a case-by-case basis that the supply, sale, transfer or carriage of the crude oil is exclusively for livelihood purposes of the nationals of the DPRK and unrelated to the DPRK’s nuclear or ballistic missile programmes or other activities prohibited by the Security Council Resolutions; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: both of the following—

subparagraph.content: the supply, sale, transfer or carriage of the crude oil will not result in the quota referred to in paragraph 4 of Resolution 2397 being exceeded;
there is no instruction from the instructing authority not to allow the supply, sale, transfer or carriage of the crude oil.

subsection.content: For an item specified in item 9 of Schedule 3, the applicable requirement is that the supply, sale, transfer or carriage of the item is for the provision of spare parts needed to maintain the safe operation of the DPRK’s commercial civilian passenger aircraft.

subsection.leadIn: If on application the Chief Executive determines that the requirement in subsection (7) is met, the Chief Executive must grant, as appropriate—

paragraph.name: a
